findings.title: Uninitialized storage pointer allows gate bypass
findings.explanation: The local struct variable `newRecord` is declared without the `memory` keyword, defaulting to a storage reference at slot 0. Writing to `newRecord.name` overwrites the `unlocked` state variable and `newRecord.mappedAddress` corrupts slot 1. This causes `unlocked` to become non-zero, so `require(unlocked)` always passes for non-zero names, bypassing the lock.
findings.fix_suggestion: Declare the struct in memory, e.g., `NameRecord memory newRecord;`, or move `require(unlocked)` to the top of the function before any state writes.

unmatched_predictions.title: Uninitialized storage pointer allows gate bypass
